terms.description:
Description: An eMobility Service Provider (eMSP) is a company or platform that gives EV drivers access to public and private charge points across multiple networks through a single app, card, or account. In Monta’s context, Monta acts as an eMSP by enabling users to discover, start, and pay for charging sessions across Monta-connected and external (roaming) networks via the Monta App.
 

 Usage x rules:
 • Always capitalize “eMSP.”
 • Spell out “eMobility Service Provider (eMSP)” on first mention.
 • Use only in contexts related to roaming, interoperability, or cross-network charging.
 • Avoid using “service provider” alone when referring to this entity.
 • In UI or partner documentation, clearly distinguish eMSP from “CPO.”
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The timestamp when a charging session, schedule, or reservation finishes. In Monta, it marks the close of a time range paired with a start time for reporting, pricing, and availability.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use for actual completion timestamps.
 • Avoid synonyms like “finish time” or “stop time” in customer-facing copy; keep “end time” consistent across surfaces.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The amount of energy delivered during a charging session, expressed in kilowatt-hours (kWh).
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charge amount”).
 • Avoid using this term to refer to price, payment, or cost.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Electric vehicle (EV): a road vehicle powered fully or primarily by electricity from a battery. In Monta, used to identify the driver’s or fleet’s vehicle type for charging, pricing, and reporting.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Article: “an EV.” Plural: “EVs.”
 • Always capitalize the abbreviation “EV.” Use sentence case for the full term in running text.
 • Avoid redundant phrasing like “EV car”; prefer “EV” or “vehicle.”
 • Use “vehicle” (not “EV”) if the context already implies electric (e.g., within an EV-only list or filter).
 • In UI labels and filters, use “EV” for brevity (e.g., “EV model,” “EV battery”); 
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE): the physical charging hardware that controls and meters energy delivery and communicates with Monta via OCPP. In Monta, “EVSE” refers to the connected charging equipment managed as a charge point in Hub and Control.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always capitalize the abbreviation “EVSE”; do not use periods.
 • Use in technical contexts (integrations, OCPP settings, installation guides). Avoid in driver-facing copy—prefer “charger” or “charge point.”
 • In UI for operators/installers, prefer “charge point”; reserve “EVSE” only where required by standards, API fields, or technical logs.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: US-centric, a government-imposed tax on specific goods or energy use in the US. A tax imposed during EV charging in the US. No direct tax directive is applicable in EU. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Do not use for VAT, sales tax, grid fees, or levies—name those specifically.
 • Do not use as a synonym for “surcharge” or “fee.” Keep terminology consistent across pricing, reporting, and exports.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A mode that defaults to a safe state when a component, signal, or process fails. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Spell with a hyphen: “fail-safe.” Do not use “failsafe” or “fail safe.”
 • Use lowercase in running text; Sentence in labels or headings.
 • Can be an adjective (“fail-safe mode”) or a countable noun (“a fail-safe”). Plural: “fail-safes.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Concept to benchmark good/bad market price on a public charge point for end-users. A filtering option in Maps in Charge app.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text: “fair price.” Do not capitalize or abbreviate.

Description: A default price applied automatically when the intended tariff or price source is unavailable. The fallback price ensures sessions can be billed when normal pricing cannot be resolved.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text: “fallback price.” In UI labels and settings, use “Fallback price.”
 • Avoid synonyms like “backup price” or “base price”; keep terminology consistent with “fallback price.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A monetary amount added to a charging session that is not the per-kWh energy price or a tax. In Monta, fees cover extras such as a fixed session fee, a per-minute time fee, or other operator-defined charges.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Plural: “fees.” Article: “a fee.”
 • In UI labels and settings, capitalize as “Fee,” and name the type explicitly (e.g., “Session fee,” “Time fee”).
 • Avoid vague terms like “extra charge” or “surcharge”; name the fee type.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A time-based fee charged for each minute of a charging session or an idle period. In Monta, it’s configured by operators and applied alongside the per-kWh energy price when enabled.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use for time-based pricing during charging or after a grace period (idle). Do not use for energy consumption—use “energy price (per kWh).”
 • Distinguish from “session fee” (fixed amount). Name the exact fee type in customer-facing copy.
 • Article: “a per-minute fee.” Plural: “per-minute fees.” Do not abbreviate.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A add-on subscription plan that extends billing, settlements, and reporting with advanced features (e.g., automated invoicing, payouts/reconciliation, and accounting exports)
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write exactly as “Finance+” (capital F, plus sign, no space). Do not use “Finance Plus” or “Finance Plus+.”
 • Do not abbreviate. Pluralize only when referring to subscriptions or entitlements (e.g., “Finance+ subscriptions”).
 • Use only for the Monta product/plan component.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: embedded software on charging hardware that provides low-level control and enables communication with Monta (e.g., via OCPP). In Monta, firmware affects safety checks, metering, connector control, and interoperability.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text: “firmware.” No abbreviation.
 • Prefer precise collocations: “firmware update,” “firmware version,” “firmware release.”
 • Plurals: use “firmware versions” (not “firmwares”)
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A static charging tariff you set either per kWh or per minute. Unlike spot pricing, the rate remains constant until you change it.
 

  Usage rules: 
 - Use in pricing settings, tariffs, and documentation; mention “spot pricing” when comparing alternatives. 
 - Use without an article in UI labels; use “a Fixed Price tariff” in running text. 
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
  Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A business-managed group of vehicles supported by Monta for public and depot charging. Includes tools for planning, cost control, load management, and future V2G workflows.
 

 Usage rules:
 - Use lowercase “fleet” in running text; capitalize only if part of a feature or stand alone UI label.
 - Use for business-operated vehicle groups; do not use for personal driver groups.
 - Do not confuse with “team” or “company” in Monta account structures.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Predictive estimates of charging demand, timing, or energy usage generated from historical and operational data. Used to plan schedules and reduce energy costs across sites.
 

 Usage rules:
 - Use lowercase in running text; capitalize only when matching a UI label or report title.
 - Use to describe predictive outputs, not commitments or reservations.
 - Not a synonym for “schedule” or “booking.”
 - No abbreviations; if used as a verb, write “to forecast.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Funds represent the withdrawable monetary balance available in a Monta wallet. Funds can be transferred to a user’s private bank account through Monta’s integrated payout system.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “funds” in running text; capitalize only when matching an exact UI label.
 • Use “balance” for the current amount; use “funds” when referring to the withdrawable money or movements.
 • Plural noun; do not abbreviate.
 • Avoid synonyms such as “credits” or “cash” in product copy.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B, B2C

Description: Limits charging so the site’s electrical fuse or circuit capacity is not exceeded. Managed through Monta load management to distribute power across charge points and prevent overloads or tripped fuses.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Do not abbreviate; avoid “fusing.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control, Charge
 Audience: B2B, B2C

Description: A short period before or after a charging session during which a driver is not charged idle fees or overstay fees.
 

 usage rules: 
 - Do not pluralize unless referring to multiple configurations (“grace periods”).
 - Use only when referring to fee-free buffer time linked to a charging session.
 - Avoid alternatives like “free time,” “buffer,” or “no-fee window.”
 - If shown in UI, ensure the exact value is displayed (e.g., “5-minute grace period”)
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The external electricity network that supplies energy to Monta-connected sites and can receive energy in V2G setups. Monta coordinates charging (e.g., load balancing, PowerBank) to avoid overloads and support grid stability.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use for the public network; for on-site wiring use “installation
 • Do not use as a synonym for “utility” or “DSO” unless explicitly named.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s premium growth-focused subscription plan providing advanced management, automation, and analytics capabilities. Designed for operators and partners scaling beyond the Free plan to increase operational efficiency.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write “Growth+” exactly with the plus sign; do not abbreviate.
 • Refer to the plan as “the Growth+ plan” in running text; use the exact label in UI.
 • Use only for the official subscription tier; do not generalize to promotions or discounts.
 • Avoid synonyms like “Pro” or “Premium” unless officially renamed.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Physical charge points and connected electrical devices integrated with the Monta platform. Compatibility and performance rely on certified integrations and firmware that enable features such as load balancing, PowerBank, and SolarCharging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text; capitalize only when part of a proper name or UI label.
 • Use “charge point” for the EVSE; avoid generic “charger” when precision is needed.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s ability to work with any compatible charge point brand or model. Enables mixing and managing multiple hardware types in one setup without vendor lock-in.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “hardware agnostic” in sentence case in running text; capitalize only in headings or UI labels.
 • Do not imply support for unsupported models; reference the certified hardware list where relevant.
 • Not a partnership or endorsement claim.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A company that designs and produces EV charge points compatible with Monta via certified integrations and APIs. Manufacturers use Hub to support configuration, firmware workflows, and reliable communication.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text; capitalize only when part of a proper name (e.g., “ABB hardware manufacturer” → “ABB”).
 • Not the same as a charge point operator (CPO) or installer; use the precise role.
 • Pluralize as “hardware manufacturers”; do not abbreviate.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s self-service knowledge base with product guides, troubleshooting articles, and instructional videos. Enables users to resolve issues and learn features across Monta products.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use the exact spelling “Help Centre” in the source (not “Help Center”); capitalize both words.
 • Use for knowledge base and support content; avoid using as a synonym for “Support” or “Status page.”
 • Use the exact label in links and buttons.
 • Do not abbreviate.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A residential EV charge point connected to Charge. Enables private users to schedule charging, use features like SolarCharging or PowerBank, and monitor energy usage at home.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; in technical contexts prefer “home charge point” for precision.
 • Do not use for workplace or public chargers.
 • Avoid using “charger” to refer to cables or adapters.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Charging an electric vehicle at a private residence using a Monta-connected home charge point via Charge. Supports scheduling, smart features (e.g., solar charging, smart charging, and session monitoring.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text (“home charging”); capitalize only in headings or UI labels.
 • Use for private residential contexts; do not use for workplace or public charging.
 • Use “home charger” or “home charge point” for the device; use “home charging” for the activity.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Monta’s residential energy management scope connecting devices like charge points, solar, smart meters, and heat pumps to optimize electricity use and self-consumption. Coordinates charging and home energy flows to reduce grid dependency.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case (“home energy”) in running text; capitalize only in headings or UI labels.
 • Use when describing the overall residential energy setup; name specific devices/features when needed.
 • Avoid using as a product name unless labeled in UI; otherwise describe the capability.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: A collective property management organization that operates shared residential charging for tenants or owners. Monta enables centralized access control, billing, and reporting across shared charge points.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only when part of a legal entity’s proper name.
 • Use for multi-dwelling/shared residential contexts; not for single-family homes or commercial sites.
 • Prefer “housing association” over “HOA” unless the local market requires that term.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: Monta’s web platform for managing charge points, sites, teams, pricing, and operations at scale. Provides tools for analytics, subscriptions, automation, and financial workflows for professional operators.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use the exact product name “Hub”; do not use “portal.” Uninflected across all languages, treated as brand-like identifier.
 • Capitalize “Hub” in all references; avoid abbreviations.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A dedicated post-launch support phase for new partners or deployments focused on proactive monitoring, rapid issue resolution, and close cross-team collaboration. Ensures a stable rollout and optimal performance across Monta products.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize “Hypercare” when referring to the formal support phase.
 • Reference the specific scope (products, SLAs, duration) when documented.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A standardized international bank account identifier used in Monta wallet to enable withdrawals, deposits, and automated payouts. Required to link a user or operator bank account for payment operations.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write “IBAN” in all caps; spell out “International Bank Account Number” on first mention if needed.
 • Do not localize the acronym; follow local formatting rules only when displaying IBANs from user input.
 • Not interchangeable with “account number” or “BIC/SWIFT.”
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A non-electric vehicle powered by petrol or diesel. Used in Monta context when contrasting with EVs in adoption, fleet transition, and operational policies.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text (“ICE vehicle” with ICE in caps).
 • Do not use “gas car” in formal copy; use “ICE vehicle.”
 • Pluralize as “ICE vehicles.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A fee applied when a vehicle remains parked and connected after charging has completed. Encourages charge point turnover and efficient site utilization.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case (“idle fee”) in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Distinguish from energy pricing; applies post-charge completion.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: The duration a vehicle stays connected after reaching full charge. Used to monitor congestion, manage turnover, and trigger idle fee policies.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case (“idle time”) in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Not a synonym for “parking time.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: The official Monta podcast available on Spotify, covering EV charging, clean tech, and the future of sustainable energy. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Treat as a proper name and write exactly “In-Between Charges” with hyphens and title case.
 • Do not translate or localize the podcast title; keep the English name in all languages.
 • Do not abbreviate (avoid “IBC”) and do not use the title to describe charging behavior.
 .
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A reported operational issue or failure within Monta systems or connected services (e.g., charge point error, API disruption, user-side fault). Incidents are tracked and resolved through support and engineering workflows.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case; capitalize only if matching a specific UI status.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

'Description: Actionable analytics and reports in Hub covering performance, usage, financials, and operational trends. Supports data-driven decisions and network optimization.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize “Insights” only if referring to a named module; otherwise use “insights” in sentence case.
 • Do not use as a synonym for “reports” when referring to downloadable invoices or receipts.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: The physical setup and configuration of EV charge points, including wiring, mounting, commissioning, and connecting hardware to Monta. Ensures safe, compliant, and functional operation.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; avoid using as a job role.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A certified technician or partner who deploys and configures charge points for operators or end users. Uses Installer Jobs to connect, test, and verify hardware during setup.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case; capitalize only when part of a proper title.
 • Not the same as a charge point operator (CPO) or site owner.
 • Pluralize as “installers”; do not abbreviate.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A predefined task in Hub granting installers temporary access to connect and commission charge points. Streamlines deployment by enabling testing and documentation without adding installers to operator teams.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Sentence title when used as a stand-alone UI label.
 • Use for time-bound commissioning tasks; not for ongoing maintenance.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A lightweight, browser-based charging flow that lets drivers start and pay for a session without installing Charge. Simplifies public, ad-hoc charging access.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize as “Instant App” when referring to the feature; avoid “web app” unless required for clarity.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: A technical connection between Monta and external systems (e.g., hardware manufacturers, payment providers, fleet tools) to enable interoperability and automation. Ensures reliable data exchange and coordinated workflows.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only when naming a specific integration.
 • Distinguish from “API” when referring to the interface itself.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: An official financial document issued by Monta summarizing charges, payments, or subscription fees. Available to users and partners via Monta Wallet and Hub for accounting and compliance.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only in UI labels or document titles.
 • Do not confuse with “receipt” (proof of payment for a single transaction).
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A unique code used to invite users to join a specific team in Monta. Entering the code grants access to the team’s charge points, wallets, and shared settings without manual admin approval (when enabled).
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write in sentence case (“join code”) in running text; capitalize to match exact UI labels (“Join code”).
 • Use “a join code” with the indefinite article; pluralize as “join codes.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: The electricity cost per kilowatt-hour applied to a charging session. Defined in a pricing group or tariff and may be fixed, dynamic, or spot-based.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case (“kWh price”) in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Distinguish from time-based pricing (per minute) and fees.
 • Do not abbreviate or use as a product name.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: Monta’s distribution of available electrical capacity across multiple charge points. Keeps total power within site or fuse limits while maximizing throughput and preventing overloads.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Distinguish from “load management” (broader strategy).
 • Avoid using as a synonym for “fuse protection.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s broader strategy to optimize energy distribution across charge points, buildings, and grid connections. Includes load balancing, dynamic power control, and integrations with smart meters and solar.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Use when describing site-wide or multi-site optimization.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s brand slogan expressing the mission to power the transition to sustainable mobility. Used in brand campaigns and high-level messaging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize each word exactly as “Made to Move.”
 • Use only in marketing or brand contexts; not as product UI text.
 • Do not translate.
 • Avoid using as a generic tagline in technical documentation.

Description: A main account is the top-level organizational account that owns and governs one or more sub-accounts. It defines global policies for access, financial ownership, and shared configuration across all linked accounts.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “main account” in running text (lowercase, no hyphen). Capitalize only when used as a UI label, menu item, or title.
 • Preferred article and plural: “a main account”; “main accounts.”
 • Pair with “sub-account” when describing hierarchy; avoid “parent/child,” “tenant,” “workspace,” or “org account.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: The visual interface in Charge showing available charge points with pricing, availability, and live status. Lets users locate, navigate to, and start sessions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize only if matching the exact UI label (“Map”).
 • Use for the driver view in Charge; not for operator fleet maps in Hub.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: The in-product area for browsing, purchasing, or managing subscription-based services such as charge discounts, operational plans, and partner offers.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize “Marketplace” when referring to the named area; otherwise use “marketplace” generically.
 • Treat as a brand name, do not translate.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: The base pricing layer for a charge point or site used as the default rate. Additional or conditional rules (e.g., member discounts, spot pricing) apply on top.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Always state unit (per kWh or per minute).
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: The personal account view in Charge for managing profile, vehicles, payment methods, linked charge points, and history.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize “Me” when referring to the UI area.
 • Use only for the consumer view in Charge; not for operator settings.
 

 Platform: Charge
 

 Audience: B2C

Description: A user who belongs to a team and can access shared charge points, wallets, and benefits according to assigned permissions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize only when referring to the role label in UI (“Member”).
 • Distinguish from “Manager” and “Owner.”
 • Use for team membership; not for marketplace or subscription membership.
 • Pluralize as “members.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A cost applied to internal team members for charging on shared or company-managed charge points. May differ from public pricing.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Distinguish from “member price” (the rate per unit).
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

escription: The internal charging rate applied to team members on shared or company-managed charge points. Typically lower than public rates.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Distinguish from “member fee” (additional cost) and “master price.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A predefined pricing configuration for specific user groups or teams. Standardizes internal charging rates and can be customized for different tiers.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Use when grouping multiple member prices under one configuration.
 • Clarify priority and inheritance relative to master price.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A user’s permission level within a team (e.g., Owner, Manager, Member) defining what actions they can perform across charge points, finances, and users.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize role names when they match exact UI labels.
 • Use for access control and governance; not a job title.
 

 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: The precision of a charge point’s energy meter for measuring consumption. Ensures compliant billing and consistent transaction reporting.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case; capitalize only in UI or compliance headings.
 • Reference standards (e.g., MID) where required.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: The unique identifier of a charge point’s energy meter used to associate readings with specific sessions or hardware.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize “ID” in all caps; keep “Meter ID” in sentence case otherwise.
 • Use as a technical identifier; not a public-facing label.
 • Keep formatting consistent with hardware documentation.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: The recorded energy measurement (kWh) consumed or delivered during a session or over a period. Forms the basis for cost calculation and usage monitoring.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: The EU Measuring Instruments Directive standard ensuring meters meet legal accuracy requirements for billing. MID-certified meters provide compliant, reliable transaction data.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write “MID” in all caps; spell out on first mention if needed.
 • Use only when referring to the directive or certified devices.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta AI is Monta’s AI-powered functionality that helps users create, summarize, or understand content and workflows across Monta products. Use it when referring to Monta’s built-in AI features, not AI in general.

Usage rules:

Use Monta AI with both words capitalized.

Do not pluralize the name (avoid “Monta AIs”); use “Monta AI features” if needed.

Use “AI” alone only after “Monta AI” has been introduced in the same piece of content.

Avoid using “bot,” “chatbot,” or “assistant” as substitutes unless that is the exact UI label.

Platform: Hub, Charge, Control

Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Monta’s toolset for remote, real-time monitoring, management, and troubleshooting of charge points across networks and sites.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use the exact product name “Control”.
 • Capitalize “Control” in all references; do not abbreviate.
 • Do not use for consumer app features (use “Charge”).
 

 Platform: Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Built-in smart charging that lets users set automated charging times directly in Charge or Hub. Optimizes energy use by scheduling during preferred hours or low-cost tariff periods without external integrations.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text and in UI labels.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A team that operates under another team and inherits defined resources or settings (e.g., permissions, wallets). Supports multi-brand, franchise, or enterprise hierarchies.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text and in UI labels.
 • Use “parent team” to describe hierarchy.
 • Do not use for ad-hoc groups; use “team” instead.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A consolidated Hub view of sites, charge points, status, and usage metrics across an operator’s network. Enables performance monitoring, uptime tracking, and data-driven actions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in UI labels, when referring to UI or in the beginning of the sentence.
 • Do not use as a synonym for “Insights” reports.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

translations.translation: panel de control – operaciones de red

terms.description:
Description: The underlying cost for electricity distribution set by the local grid or utility. Used by Monta in pricing, forecasting, and smart charging logic to optimize costs and protect capacity.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text and in UI labels.
 • Distinguish from energy price (commodity) and taxes/fees.
 • Reference the source (DSO/utility) and time windows when relevant.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Near Field Communication used to start a charge by tapping an NFC-enabled device or card (e.g., charge key, smartphone) on compatible charge points. Provides secure, convenient authentication.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write the acronym “NFC”; spell out on first mention if needed.
 • Use for authentication at the charger; not for in-app (Charge) flows.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A Network Operations Center user responsible for real-time monitoring, troubleshooting, and support of Monta-connected charge points. Helps maintain uptime, resolve incidents, and ensure continuity for large operators.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text (“NOC agent” with NOC in caps).
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Open Charge Point Interface used for interoperability between charging networks. Monta uses OCPI for roaming, session sharing, and pricing synchronization.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write “OCPI” in all caps; spell out on first mention if needed.
 • Use for eMSP/CPO roaming data exchange; not for charger-to-backend control.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: The pricing structure communicated to roaming partners via OCPI so external eMSPs receive consistent price information for cross-network sessions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case; capitalize only in UI labels or spec names.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Open Charge Point Protocol for communication between charge points and back-end systems. Monta uses OCPP to control, monitor, and configure multi-brand hardware.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write “OCPP” in all caps; spell out on first mention if needed.
 • Do not conflate with OCPI (roaming).
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s internal environment for validating and debugging charge point integrations, including firmware testing, message validation, and configuration checks.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize to match the internal tool name.
 • Use for integration and QA contexts.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Open InterCharge Protocol by Hubject enabling roaming interoperability between networks and eMSPs. Used by Monta for cross-network availability, authentication, and pricing data exchange.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write “OICP” in all caps; spell out on first mention if needed.
 • Distinguish from OCPI; specify which protocol is used per partner.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Activities or locations at the physical place where charge points are installed and managed (e.g., installation, maintenance, inspections).
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use a hyphen (“on-site”) in running text; avoid title case unless a heading.
 • Use for physical presence; for remote work use “off-site” or “remote.”
 • Distinguish from “site” (the entity in Hub).
 

 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: The full name of OCPP, a communication standard that enables EV charge points and back-end systems to exchange operational and transactional data. Ensures interoperability across hardware vendors.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use when spelling out the standard; pair with “(OCPP)” on first mention.
 • Follow the same versioning and usage rules as “OCPP.”
 • Not a roaming protocol (use OCPI/OICP).
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

translations.translation: Protocolo abierto de punto de recarga

terms.description: Businesses selling, installing, and setting up charge points for themselves or their clients.

Description: The team entity in Monta that represents an operator’s organization. Manages charge points, wallets, and pricing under one operational unit.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text and in UI labels.
 • Distinguish from “parent team” and “nested team” in nested structures.
 

 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Facilitate direct charging transactions, when one private individual (the seller) allows another (the buyer) to charge an EV at their charge point, and payment is made directly from the buyer to the seller using the Monta platform. Used in invoiced.
Verb, to link or connect a charge key (such as an RFID card) with a charge point or user account in a platform, allowing the key to be recognized and authorized for charging sessions.
Functionality in Hub. Tied to Nested Teams. It is a hosting Team of a Nested Team. Source and target capitalization intact.
4-digit authentication code required upon handling payments via Monta Wallet. EU + UK requirement in the payment law.
A standard term for a password used to log into Monta systems.
Label of 'Payment' button in Hub. It provides an overview of Wallet balance, transactions & invoices, as well as enables deposit, and withdrawal of funds.
Label of subheader in the Wallet, i.e. credit card, RFID, MobilePay, Vipps.
A payment terminal is a device used to process electronic payments from customers.
The timeframe, in which many users want to charge.
Established taxation term applied in b2c context.  Unique identifier assigned to individuals by a government’s tax authority, used for managing tax-related activities.
Feature enables instant charging upon cable connection, as an alternative to RFID and app authentication, for Monta-operated Charge Points.
Grid service feature that connects charging points to the grid system, allowing Monta to pause and resume charging based on the grid’s imbalance at any given moment.
A price configuration setting enabling to set-up end-user price, containing marging, add ons. etc.
Charge point access rights: Only team members linked to a private charge point can access it and apply pricing. Public charge points are accessible via roaming
Team type for private home users and partners, created in Hub, allowing the owner to invite multiple home users
Subscription plan, targetting smaller sites that need to manage multiple charge points. Source and target capitalization intact.
A prediction of how much electricity a solar panel system will generate over a specific period, based on system specifications and local weather conditions
A type of Team (feature), designed to cater  a variety of B2B needs, such as  Housing association, Parking, Hotel, and Company.
Team type for housing associations and businesses
A code that gives the user a discount on a charge. This will be stored in user's Wallet.
Publicly available charge point.

Public price is applied to publicly available charge points. There are 4 price groups in total, i.e. member, public, reimbursed, and cost price group.  A price group is comprised of a master price (set per minute, kWh or spot price) and additional fees ( minute, stat, charging, idle fee)
Verb, to shut down and restoring power to a charge point, either manually or remotely, to restart it. Can be used as verb and noun.
Italian billing compliance term, used in Italy-only to identify the recipient of an e-Invoice). No equlavent concepts in other languages, thus do a literal translation.
Subheader title of referal label in 'Me' section in the mobile app. Enabling discount when a new user is being referred to Monta by an existing user. Source and target capitalization intact.
Used in the context of Referal feature, where an existing user can invite a new member and receive a charging balance of certain amount
Verb. Top off a Wallet. Sometimes used also "charge", make sure to distinguish between monetary and electricity charge.

A feature, allowing employers to reimburse their employees for charge sessions. Variations Home Reimbursement ( b2c, Charge mobile app) Employer Reimbursement (b2b, Hub web app)  Replacement of the legacy feature name "Sponsored Charging".
A money amount per kWh that users' employee receives, as reimbursement for their electricity use when charging at home.

Measurement of how consistent, error-free operation of a charge point or network is, i.e. measured by uptime and availability. A key quality metric in the EV industry used to assess infrastructure performance
Type of charging, accommodated in a residential area.
EU VAT regulation term. A mechanisms where buyer, not the seller, reports and pays the VAT, used in cross-border B2B sales. VAT is shown as 0% on invoices with a reverse charge note.
See "Charge key" term, synonyms. Source and target capitalization intact.
A high-level overview of the software development process. Monta provides a Public Roadmap, displaying planned features, those in development, and those launched
Enables EV-drivers to find, access and pay for charging across multiple public networks.
US-centric term - a tax  % imposed on the sale of goods and services at the point of purchase, paid by end-user.  In EU countries, the VAT (Value Added Tax) is the equivalent of the U.S. sales tax
Verb. used as CTA for a planning feature, allowing adjustment of the charging timeslot.
Charge method: The ability to set a specific time or schedule for starting or completing the EV charging process
Adjective, self-healing refers to systems or software that can automatically detect, diagnose, and resolve issues without human intervention

A pan-European direct debit system that allows merchants and businesses to collect Euro-denominated payments from accounts in the 36 SEPA (Single Euro Payments Area) countries. Source and target capitalization intact.
A unique identifier assigned to a charging device, used for tracking and management within a network.
Stakeholder, that provides charging services (monthly subscriptions), e.g. charge point operator.
Shop feature, where Monta branded charge keys, RDIF, stickers are purchased.
Single Sign-On. SSO is an authentication scheme that allows a user to log in with a single ID to any of several related, yet independent, software systems.
Refers to a charging site, often used synonymously. Use established translations for "charging site" when the source mentions "site* to reduce ambigiouty
An entity that has installed charge points within their premises, e.g. parking lot owner.
A verb describing a charging method based on user preferences, such as cost, renewable energy, and CO2 footprint, when the 'SmartCharge* feature is enabled.
Noun. Feature enabling to charge EV, when energy is at its lowest price or is greenest. Non-translatable.

B2C feature in mobile app, enables EV charging directly from solar panels, using real-time or forecasted production data. Helps maximise self-consumption, reduce grid reliance, lower energy costs, and minimise carbon footprint. Can be configured to operate only when surplus solar energy is available.
The process of using excess solar energy generated by a photovoltaic (PV) system to charge an electric vehicle (EV)
A unique identifier of the individual branch or bank office where a bank account is held.

Spot price defines a master price based on Nordpool data (leading power market in Europe), accounting for electricity price fluctuations. When setting up a price group, a master price is selected per kWh, minute, or spot data. Available only in markets with Nordpool access.
Single sign-on. SSO is an authentication scheme that allows a user to log in with a single ID to any of several related, yet independent, software systems.

Fee description (visible to users) applied when charging starts. A one-off fee at the beginning of the charge. Used in the price group context, with four fee types in total: starting fee, charging fee, minute fee, and idle fee
Start time of a charge session, used in the "Schedule" feature, one of the charge methods (Charge now, SmartCharge, and Schedule)
It refers to the current battery charge level as a percentage of its total capacity.
An invoice overview, a total overview of the parts that makes up the invoice for a certain period of time.
A unique identifier for a specific charge station. A technical term, used in technical and software documentations. 3rd party term Advenir
Monthly newsletter's title
QR code, enables access to the charging service.
Settings under Team settings in Portal. Support settings are mapped out in 3 sub-categories, i.e. Monta, installer and operator to differentiate which support falls under which actor.

Role access functionality for Business plan users in HUB, enabling to diversify access permissions for team members within an account. Supporter  role  is dedicated to the support team and handles end-users queries, troubleshooting issues with charge points.
Excess electricity generated beyond immediate consumption needs, which can be stored, used for charging, or fed back into the grid.
Verb, CTA for approving and enabling certain task in the consumer app.
See "Network tariff" for more details. Used both as stand-alone "tariff" and as "network tariff"
A Tax Identification in the US,  a unique number assigned by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to individuals and entities for tax reporting purposes. European equivalent is VAT number
Italian billing compliance term, used in Italy-only for fiscal activities. No equlavent concepts in other languages, thus do a literal translation.
Feature: A team manages charge points, members, prices, access, Wallet, and more. There are 4 team types: personal, private, professional, and operator.
Functionality, enabling partners to brand Monta's software services with their branding elements.
Monta retains 2 % of each transaction, occurring during a paid charge session.
Concept - users in a general sense and encompasses all segments groups within b2c, b2b, b2p.
Role of the user in a team in the portal (e.g. Member, Administrator, ..)
A VAT identification number (or VAT number) identifies a business registered for VAT, used for cross-border trade within the EU and internationally. Format - country code + numeric/alphanumeric ID
EU VAT regulation term, applied in use cases, where 0% VAT rate is applied. Zero-rated VAT must be reported appropriately in transactions.

Refers to the Vehicle Identification Number (VIN), a unique code that identifies a vehicle and provides details about its manufacturing. "VIN" is globally standardized and commonly used across languages. For clarity in long-form content, it can be spelled out with local translation
Monta's financial service feature, which facilitates transactions to and from bank accounts, payments, reimbursements etc.
Service, where Monta resells tech solutions to another company. The buying company rebrands the service as their own.
Entities that specialize in selling EV charge points in bulk or on a wholesale level.
Refers to charging accommodated at a work place
